**Red Lentils in Lentil Soup:**
Yes, you can definitely use red lentils instead of green or brown lentils in the soup recipe. Red lentils are actually a popular choice for soups because they break down quickly and create a thicker, creamier consistency. Keep in mind that red lentils will cook slightly faster than green or brown lentils, so check on them after 20-25 minutes of simmering. They should be tender and mushy, which is perfect for a comforting soup.

**Store-bought Kimchi in Korean-Style Chicken Bowl:**
Absolutely! You can use store-bought kimchi instead of making your own for the Korean-Style Chicken Bowl. In fact, store-bought kimchi can be a great time-saver and still add plenty of flavor to your dish. Just be sure to check the ingredients and nutrition label to ensure the kimchi doesn't contain any added sugars, preservatives, or excessive sodium.

Some tips when using store-bought kimchi:

* Choose a kimchi with a good balance of spicy and sour flavors.
* If the kimchi is too spicy, you can always add a bit of rice vinegar or lime juice to tone down the heat.
* Consider chopping the kimchi into smaller pieces or slicing it thinly to distribute the flavors evenly throughout the dish.
* You can also use kimchi as a topping or mix it into the quinoa or rice for added flavor.

I hope this helps, and I'm excited for you to try out these recipes!
